column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=All evidence is that he was not a predator , but that he was a voice for change of age-of-consent laws .
#Text=To me , it 's a non-issue .
#Text=Put your hand on my kid and believe me , it 's all over for the predator .
#Text=That 's my policy .
#Text=When someone 's 18 , that 's the deal .
#Text=I 'll stick with the law on that one .
#Text=What 's a lesson your mother taught you ?
#Text=To never give up .
#Text=She was supportive even when I made mistakes , as a good mother will do .
#Text=In school my parents were called up a lot .
#Text=It was not easy being a parent of Frankie .
#Text=Teachers were constantly calling .
#Text=I was disruptive , I would talk out of line , I was a class clown .
#Text=She taught me to never give up no matter what vocation you choose in your life .
#Text=My mother was never critical of my poems and writing .
#Text=We 're good friends and she 's a lot of fun .
#Text=How would you choose your death ?
#Text=Either in battle or laying in bed with family around me .
#Text=Have you ever had a moment where you saw your death ?
#Text=Yes , a couple of times .
#Text=Once I was on one of those small planes flying to Pittsburgh last year to see the Mets , actually one of those 25-seat airplanes flying out of Newark in a lightning storm .
#Text=We had ascended over Newark and the plane was struck by lightning .
#Text=There was no panic on the plane at all , but something , we knew , was terribly wrong .
#Text=I saw a flash of light when it hit the plane and a fellow across the aisle said , " Did you just see that ? "
#Text=and I said that I thought we were struck by lightning .
#Text=He said it felt like something got ripped off the plane .
#Text=There was so much turbulence .
#Text=The stewardess came out with one of the co-pilots , who announced we were struck by lightning , but that we were going to continue the flight .
#Text=There was a moment there , I think a good 30 seconds , where I was certain the plane was going to break apart .
#Text=Did you have any realizations ?
#Text=I thought , this is it .
#Text=This is it .
#Text=There was acceptance .
#Text=When my father was diagnosed with cancer in June of 2005 and I got to see a man who accepted his fate .
#Text=He died two months later .
#Text=He was like the Captain of the Titanic .
#Text=My mother was also calm .
#Text=I was the one freaking out inside .
#Text=I saw someone who had acknowledged his own demise , accepted it , and died at home .
#Text=He was a tough old guy .
#Text=It takes a lot to accept that , it takes a very strong person .
#Text=In this culture we value life very much , and some people look at death as a failure , but it 's going to happen to all of us .
#Text=My theory is to help yourself , and help others in life .
